title: A RAND Virtual Event: The View of the Taiwan Strait from the U.S.-Japan Alliance
descriptions: The RAND Corporation has organized a series of conversations that focus on the U.S.-Japan Alliance in an era of strategic competition. This second event will examine the Taiwan Strait issue from the perspectives of Japan and the United States.

sub_content.What: This second event will examine the Taiwan Strait issue from the perspectives of Japan and the United States.

sub_content.Who: Matthew Pottinger, former U.S. deputy national security advisor and former Asia director, National Security Council. Cortez Cooper, senior international/defense researcher, the RAND Corporation Matsuda Yasuhiro, professor of International Politics, University of Tokyo Dr. Sheila Smith, John E. Merow senior fellow for Asia-Pacific Studies, Council on Foreign Relations Jeffrey W. Hornung, senior political scientist, the RAND Corporation, moderator

sub_content.When: Monday, October 10, 2022, 9:30 a.m. to 12 noon ET

sub_content.RSVP: Click here to register and request a link to this virtual event.

sub_content.Interviews:
To arrange an interview, contact the RAND Office of Media Relations:

content.Article: The RAND Corporation has organized a series of conversations that focus on the U.S.-Japan Alliance in an era of strategic competition.
